subject: Parenting
title: Learning Styles Are Real
description: A quick win: understand Learning Styles Are Real.

hook.text: 'My child is a visual learner.' It sounds scientific. Decades of research say it's a myth.

buildup.text: The theory claims children learn best when taught in their preferred style â€” visual, auditory, kinesthetic.

discovery.text: Study after study has failed to find evidence that matching teaching to learning styles improves outcomes.

twist.text: Everyone benefits from multiple modalities. The best teaching uses all channels, not just one.

climax.text: The myth persists because it feels intuitively true â€” preferences exist, but they don't predict learning.

punchline.text: Learning preferences are real. Learning styles aren't.

quiz.question: What does research say about teaching to individual learning styles?
options: It only works for visual learners
